achievements: Known for films like 'Dead Man Walking', 'Mystic River', and 'Milk'
Founded the colony of Pennsylvania based on principles of religious tolerance and fair dealing with Native Americans
Wrote influential works on Quaker theology and political philosophy
Directed critically acclaimed films such as 'Bonnie and Clyde' (1967), 'Little Big Man' (1970), and 'Night Moves' (1975)
Won a Tony Award for directing the play 'The Miracle Worker'
